Description: Postcard; printed paper; shows an Arab street stall, Cairo.
Curator's comments: Old card; very good condition; postally used, postmarked Marseille, 1st October 1909 but the stamp has been previously soaked off. The message reads: "A P.C. [postcard] for your collection. Have passed thro' [through] the Suez Canal & have reached middle of the Red Sea. A blazing hot day & very little improvement tonight". The card is signed by one Cyril Ponting. The message is very typical of postcards written on the long Red Sea voyage between Cairo and Aden (as the content and place of production of the card implies), but the opening sentence is particularly appropriate for the present context of a card for the British Museum's postcard collection.
Associated names: Named in inscription: Miss J Drake
